tool.name: ExecuteRoadwayLevelAttributeValidations

param.name: job__started_date
param.displayname: Edits Start Date (i.e. WMX Job Creation Date)
param.dialogReference: Typically this parameter is passed in via Workflow Manager. During ad-hoc execution of this tool, you can specify the date you would like the validations to use as a minimum date. The parameter is used to query the EDITED_DATE field on the Milepoint table, finding edits where the EDITED_DATE is greater than the Job Started Date.

param.name: job__owned_by
param.displayname: Editor Username (i.e. WMX Owned by User)
param.dialogReference: Typically this parameter is passed in via Workflow Manager. During ad-hoc execution of this tool, you can set the username you would like to use to query the Milepoint table EDITED_BY field. The Job Owned By parameter is used in conjunction with the Job Satrted Date parameter to determine which edits a user has made since they kicked off their Workflow Manager job.

param.name: job__id
param.dialogReference: Typically this parameter is passed in via Workflow Manager. During ad-hoc execution of this tool, you can pass in the Workflow Manager Job ID (found in the ArcMap title bar at the end of the "HDS_GENERAL_EDITING_JOB_xxxxx" string). The Job ID parameter is used in conjunction with the Job Owned By parameter to reconstruct the database version's name if the version was constructed using Workflow Manager. The Job ID parameter is also used in conjunction with the Job Owned By paramter to query the reviewer workspace tables for the Reviewer Session name.

param.name: production_ws
param.dialogReference: An SDE file that points to the database containing the edits you would like to validate.

param.name: reviewer_ws
param.dialogReference: An SDE file or file geodatabase that has been abled as a Data Reviewer Workspace. The results of the validations will be written here.

param.name: log_path
param.dialogReference: A .txt filepath to output execution information.

param.name: log_level
param.dialogReference: The level to be set for the Python logger and the arcpy messages. Use INFO to print fewer messages, use DEBUG to print more messages. Defaults to DEBUG.

param.name: full_db_flag
param.displayname: Run Validations on Full Geodatabase (Instead of edits)
param.dialogReference: When left unchecked, the recently edited routes will be validated. When checked, all "Active Routes" (defined by TO_DATE IS NULL) will be validated in the version.

tool.summary: Requires the Data Reviewer licesnse. Runs a set of validations written in Python against the ELRS.LRSN_Milepoint table. These validations ensure that the Milepoint attribution's "Roadway Level Attributes" are valid based on their ROADWAY_TYPE value. If a Roads and Highways route is found to violate one or more of these validations, its geometry is passed to the Write to Reviewer Table geoprocessing tool along with a description of the violation. These results will appear in the Reviewer Session and Reviewer Table. These validations do not run on retired data (defined by TO_DATE IS NULL).
tool.usage:
• The Job Start Date parameter should refer to the date from which the edits needing validation begain. Typically passed into the tool via a Workflow Manager token.

  • The Job Owned By parameter should refer to the username committed to the EDITED_DATE field on the Milepoint table.

  • The Job ID parameter refers to the Workflow Manager Job ID, which is used to recreate the Production Workspaceversion name.

  • Production Workspace must be an enterprise geodatabase, referred to by an SDE file.

  • The Reviewer Workspace parameter usually referse to an enterprise geodatabase that has been configured as a Data Reviewer Workspace. Also works with file geodatabases.

  • The Full Database Flag when checked will ignore the EDITED_DATE, and instead run the validations on the entirety of the Milepoint table.

  • When the Log Path parameter is provided as a filepath pointing to a text file (.txt), the tool will log execution messages to the file.

  • The Logging Level parameter sets the level for the file logger and the arcpy GP tool messages. Use 'DEBUG' for more messages, use 'INFO' to limit the number of messages.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Requires the Data Reviewer licesnse. Runs a set of validations written in Python against the ELRS.LRSN_Milepoint table. These validations ensure that the Milepoint attribution's "Roadway Level Attributes" are valid based on their ROADWAY_TYPE value. If a Roads and Highways route is found to violate one or more of these validations, its geometry is passed to the Write to Reviewer Table geoprocessing tool along with a description of the violation. These results will appear in the Reviewer Session and Reviewer Table. These validations do not run on retired data (defined by TO_DATE IS NULL).
